Description: Sherd of pedestal with splaying foot and part of bowl of pottery standed bowl, probably a thymiaterion; large nipple at centre of floor; the wall turns up at the break, suggesting this is not a plate. Fine light brown clay; metallic black glaze. Glazed disc at centre of floor with two white rings enclosing red ring; some glaze near bottom of wall outside, with irregular reserved area below; stem and foot glazed with three pairs of white and red bands; underside reserved.
Curator's comments: A puzzling piece; the clay is suggestive of Lakonia.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.78)
